result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Hilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Added to payment plan granted in 16CT140.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 16CT140.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Hilton

defendant.name: Hilton, Michael D
defendant.address: 121 Pamela St, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Satorius.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge in 16CT140 and to the charge in 16CM110.  Court advised the elements and possible penalties in the counts the defendant plead to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, contrary to 961.573(1) in 16CM110 and Operate without a valid DL, 3rd, contrary to 343.05(3)(a) in 16CT140.  State recommended in 16CT140.  60 days jail.  Consecutive to any sentence now serving.  $100.00 fine, plus costs in 16CM110.   Defense recommended the same, except that the jail run concurrent with his sentence, and only 30 days.  

Court ordered:  16CT140:   60 days jail.  Consecutive to any sentence now serving.  CC.  Credit for 1 day.
                          16CM110:  30 days jail.  Concurrent to 16CT140.  CC  Pay @ $25/mo starting 9/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Credit for 1 day.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled and set for PLEAS at request of Atty Satorius; ok'd with DA's office.

Pre-trial conference on February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on February 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
The defendant appears by video from the Jackson County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appears by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court, specially for Atttorney Satorius.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 2/1 and STC set for 2/27 at 3 pm.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Covers 16CM110 and 16CT140.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  No reporter.  Recorded by FTR.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  He said he didn't get notice of the appearance.  He had a bond so he was notified.  He said he was in jail in Monroe Co.  AIA set for 1/9 at 9 am. Contact SPD.  Other attorney options explained to the defendant.  He understood.  He has contacted SPD and qualifies.
Special Prosecutor, Rebecca Maki-Wallender appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant did not appear for the initial appearance.  Warrant authorized.
